Psalms__07.1: The psalm of David which he sung to the Lord for the words of Chusi the son of Jemini. [2 Kings 16]
Psalms__07.2: O Lord my God, in thee have I put my trust: save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me.
Psalms__07.3: Lest at any time he seize upon my soul like a lion, while there is no one to redeem me, nor to save.
Psalms__07.4: O Lord my God, if I have done this thing, if there be iniquity in my hands:
Psalms__07.5: If I have rendered to them that repaid me evils, let me deservedly fall empty before my enemies.
Psalms__07.6: Let the enemy pursue my soul, and take it, and tread down my life on the earth, and bring down my glory to the dust.
Psalms__07.7: Rise up, O Lord, in thy anger: and be thou exalted in the borders of my enemies. And arise, O Lord my God, in the precept which thou hast commanded:
Psalms__07.8: And a congregation of people shall surround thee. And for their sakes return thou on high.
Psalms__07.9: The Lord judgeth the people. Judge me, O Lord, according to my justice, and according to my innocence in me.
Psalms__07.10: The wickedness of sinners shall be brought to nought: and thou shalt direct the just: the searcher of hearts and reins is God.
Psalms__07.11: Just is my help from the Lord: who saveth the upright of heart.
Psalms__07.12: God is a just judge, strong and patient: is he angry every day?
Psalms__07.13: Except you will be converted, he will brandish his sword: he hath bent his bow and made it ready.
Psalms__07.14:
And in it he hath prepared the instruments of death, he hath made ready his arrows<u>
                for them that burn
               </u>.
Psalms__07.15: Behold he hath been in labour with injustice; he hath conceived sorrow, and brought forth iniquity.
Psalms__07.16: He hath opened a pit and dug it; and he is fallen into the hole he made.
Psalms__07.17: His sorrow shall be turned on his own head: and his iniquity shall comedown upon his crown.
Psalms__07.18: I will give glory to the Lord according to his justice: and will sing to the name of the Lord the most high.
